description:
It's become clear to many that Red Hat's recent missteps with CentOS and the availability of RHEL source code indicate that it's fallen from it's respected place as "the open organization." SUSE seems to be poised to benefit from Red Hat's errors. We connect the dots.

The post How SUSE Is Replacing Red Hat as the Linux and Open Source Enterprise Standard-Bearer appeared first on FOSS Force.
title: How SUSE Is Replacing Red Hat as the Linux and Open Source Enterprise Standard-Bearer
